question: 編む
sourceMnemonic: Because the hiragana ends with an <ja>う</ja> sound, you know this word is a verb. The kanji itself means <kanji>knit</kanji> so the verb vocab version is <vocabulary>to knit</vocabulary>.
sourceReadingMnemonic: When you start <vocabulary>to knit</vocabulary>, you always end up with the same thing every time when you're done, no matter what you're trying to make: The letter "<reading>A</reading>" (<ja>あ</ja>). It's so frustrating that you can't knit anything else.
